page.title: 13History of Chobham Industry
page.content:
In 1600 there was{Brick making.}The bricks were made from clay found under the grass on{Chobham Common.}Bricks were made around Chobham until about 1880. { {Glass making}occured in Burrow Hill. Silica sand was used in glass making. The glass making site is known as the treacle mines. The site is now the {Metco works, a light metal work {industry.
Trades in Chobham included 3{weavers,} 3{smiths,}1{leather worker}and 1 {miller.}The smiths were important because they made horse shoes and made iron implements such as nails, hinges and bolts. There was also a{printing works started by the Medhurst family.
